red_flags.action: Immediate IV artesunate and referral to hospital
Check for severe malaria, IV fluids, antimalarials
Oxygen therapy, IV artesunate, careful fluid management
IV glucose bolus + infusion, IV antimalarials

criteria: Fever or history of fever in past 48 hours
No other obvious cause of fever
Residence in or travel to malaria-endemic area
Positive thick/thin blood smear with parasites visible

treatment_algorithm.title: Assess Severity
treatment_algorithm.description: Determine if uncomplicated or severe malaria based on WHO criteria
special_considerations: Severe malaria: any danger sign (prostration, seizures, altered consciousness, jaundice, respiratory distress, severe anemia)

treatment_algorithm.title: Uncomplicated Malaria Treatment

medications.name: Artemether-Lumefantrine (Coartem)
medications.dosage: 4 tablets (20mg/120mg) for adults, weight-based for children

treatment_algorithm.follow_up: Day 3: Check if fever cleared. Day 28: Check for recurrence
special_considerations: Take with food or milk to improve absorption
Complete full 3-day course even if feeling better
Pregnant women: Use artesunate-based ACT after first trimester

treatment_algorithm.title: Severe Malaria Treatment
treatment_algorithm.description: For patients with danger signs - REFER TO HOSPITAL

medications.name: Artesunate IV
medications.dosage: 2.4 mg/kg IV at 0, 12, 24 hours, then daily
medications.duration: Minimum 24 hours, then switch to oral ACT for 3 days

medications.name: Artemether IM (if IV not available)
medications.dosage: 3.2 mg/kg IM loading, then 1.6 mg/kg daily

treatment_algorithm.follow_up: Daily monitoring until stable, weekly for 4 weeks
special_considerations: Check hemoglobin weekly for delayed hemolysis
Pre-referral treatment: Give IM artemether or rectal artesunate

treatment_algorithm.title: Supportive Care

medications.name: Paracetamol
side_effects: Rare: liver toxicity at high doses

special_considerations: DO NOT use aspirin (risk of Reye's syndrome in children)

complications.name: Cerebral malaria
complications.prevention: Early diagnosis and treatment with effective antimalarials
complications.management: IV artesunate, supportive ICU care, manage seizures

complications.name: Severe malarial anemia
complications.prevention: Insecticide-treated bed nets, chemoprevention in pregnancy
complications.management: Blood transfusion if Hb < 5 g/dL, antimalarials, iron supplementation

complications.name: Acute kidney injury
complications.management: IV fluids, monitor urine output, consider dialysis

complications.name: Pulmonary edema/ARDS
complications.management: Oxygen, diuretics, mechanical ventilation if needed

prevention.target_population: All residents in endemic areas, especially children and pregnant women
prevention.effectiveness: Reduces malaria incidence by 50%, all-cause mortality in children by 20%

prevention.target_population: All pregnant women in endemic areas
prevention.effectiveness: Sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine monthly from 2nd trimester reduces placental malaria by 30%
Monthly SP+AQ during transmission season reduces cases by 75%
Prevents progression to severe malaria, reduces transmission

references.title: Management of severe malaria: A practical handbook
